title: Google's Q3 Earnings: AI, Innovation, and the Future of Tech
description: In this episode, we dive into Google's 2024 Q3 earnings call, where CEO Sundar Pichai highlights how AI innovation, Cloud, YouTube, and more are driving extraordinary growth and change at Alphabet.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Hello and welcome to another episode of 'life is artificial', where we explore the cutting edge of technology, innovation, and what the future could look like.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Today, we're diving into the highlights from Google's 2024 Q3 earnings call. It's packed with insights into how the tech giant is advancing its AI capabilities, expanding its cloud services, and growing its platforms like YouTube and Waymo. CEO Sundar Pichai provided some impressive numbers and updates, and we're here to break it all down for you.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Let me start with the key takeaway: Google's commitment to AI is clearly paying off, and it's driving incredible momentum across the company. Sundar Pichai opened with a powerful statement about Google's focus on innovation and investment in AI, positioning the company to lead in what he called the 'era of AI'. And they really do seem to have a full-stack approach to AI innovation that’s starting to operate at scale.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: This full-stack approach is driven by three components: robust AI infrastructure, world-class research teams, and a broad global reach through products and platforms. Let’s talk about that AI infrastructure first. Google has made significant investments in data centers, specialized AI chips, and their global fiber network — they're not just playing around here; they want to lead. They’re also making bold moves in clean energy, including securing the world’s first corporate agreement for nuclear power from small modular reactors. It's all part of their plan to power their operations with 24/7 carbon-free energy, and it’s exciting to see a tech company think about the future of sustainability alongside innovation.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Another crucial part of Google’s success is their research teams. The DeepMind team has been instrumental in pushing forward AI research. You may have heard the name DeepMind when AlphaFold came into the spotlight for protein folding. Sundar Pichai congratulated Demis Hassabis and John Jumper for winning the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for their work on AlphaFold. And guess what, Google also has Geoff Hinton, the ‘Godfather of AI,’ who won a Nobel Prize in Physics. This is the kind of talent they have on board. Their research teams are responsible for advancing their AI model, Gemini, which is now being used in more and more products.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Speaking of Gemini, this model is seeing rapid adoption. It's already integrated into Google products like Search, Maps, and more, touching billions of users each month. Google even shared that they're making Gemini available for developers, and it’s already being used with GitHub Copilot. This means Google’s AI is not just something behind the scenes, but it’s becoming a tool that developers and users can actively engage with.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: And with this increased integration of AI comes enhanced productivity. Sundar mentioned that now over a quarter of all new code at Google is generated by AI. Imagine that: AI is writing code, reviewed and accepted by human engineers. This helps Google move faster and be more agile. It’s a fascinating look at how AI is transforming not just customer-facing products, but the internal workings of a company.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Moving on to the core Google products, we’ve seen some amazing advancements in Search. Features like AI Overviews, Circle to Search, and Lens are changing how people search for information and engage with Google. AI Overviews are now reaching over a billion users, and it’s encouraging longer, more complex queries. Lens, which lets you search by taking a picture, is seeing 20 billion visual searches per month — that’s huge. These features are making search more visual, more interactive, and much more aligned with how we think and perceive the world around us.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Another area Google is growing fast is their Cloud business. They generated $11.4 billion in Q3, which is up 35% from last year, with a 17% operating margin. That's serious growth. The Gemini AI models are integrated into Google Cloud through their Vertex AI platform, and it’s helping big clients like Snap create more engaging experiences. One thing I found fascinating is how they’re combining AI with their data platform, BigQuery. Customers are using this to analyze multimodal data with ultra-low latency, which is incredibly useful for real-time decision making.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: And let's not forget YouTube. For the first time, YouTube’s combined ad and subscription revenue over the past year crossed $50 billion. They’re focusing heavily on YouTube TV, including the NFL Sunday Ticket, and leaning into the living room experience. Plus, there’s an exciting announcement about a new AI model called Veo that’s going to help YouTube Shorts creators generate even more engaging content.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Before I wrap up, let’s talk about Waymo. Google’s self-driving car subsidiary is also a huge part of their future. Waymo is driving more than a million fully autonomous miles every week and has partnered with Uber and Hyundai to expand its reach. This kind of mainstream adoption shows that Waymo is a clear leader in the autonomous vehicle industry. The partnership with Uber means that more people are going to have access to self-driving cars sooner than we might have thought possible.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: So, that’s the big picture from Google’s Q3 earnings call. It’s really all about AI — from improving core products like Search and YouTube, to advancing the frontier with Waymo and Cloud services. Google is focusing on speed, agility, and making AI accessible to as many people and developers as possible.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Thanks for tuning in to this episode of 'life is artificial'. If you enjoyed today’s episode, make sure to subscribe and share it with anyone you think would love to hear about the future of AI and technology. Until next time, keep dreaming of the future — because it’s closer than you think.
